intro: Boechera selbyi, commonly known as Selby's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early spring. The plant has a compact growth habit and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
